intro: Berkheya excelsa, commonly known as the silver tree, is a striking South African plant characterized by its silvery-blue foliage and tall, branching structure. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is native to the coastal regions of South Africa. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it its distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers in the summer months, which are clustered in a rounded inflorescence. Berkheya excelsa is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
